t: List of Amazon brands - Wikipedia
s: November 26, 2024 - Amazon offers multiple lines of privately labeled products. These are available on Amazon.com, Amazon Fresh, Prime Pantry, Prime Now, Amazon Go, and Whole Foods Market. Amazon houses its in-house brand offerings under the “Our Brands” label, which is separate from exclusive brands.

t: The Complete Guide to Amazon’s Private Label Brands | Pattern
s: Amazon introduced its first in-house brands—AmazonBasics and Pinzon, which both sell everyday household goods—in 2009. Only in the past few years, however, has the company ramped up its focus on private label creation.

t: In-Depth Study of All 92 Amazon Private Label Brands
s: Amazon stated in 2019 that they have 158,000 private brand products across 45 brands. However, The Wall Street Journal reported in 2023 that dozens of brands were being phased out, leaving Amazon with fewer than 20 house brands, particularly in apparel and furniture.

t: Amazon (company) - Wikipedia
s: 12 hours ago - Amazon sells many products under its own brand names, including phone chargers, batteries, and diaper wipes. The AmazonBasics brand was introduced in 2009, and now features hundreds of product lines, including smartphone cases, computer mice, batteries, dumbbells, and dog crates.

t: Amazon Private Label Brands - Marketplace Pulse
s: March 18, 2019 - According to Marketplace Pulse research, Amazon-owned private label brands are not nearly as successful as many paint them to be. Amazon has been successful in creating generic items at low prices, but only when using the Amazon brand name (i.e., AmazonBasics and Amazon Essentials).
